title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.9 | 30-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janashalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual master.

segments.key_quote: Your respectable younger brother who possesses the strength of 10,000 elephants killed by his grace Jarasandha whose feet were worshipped by many kings.
segments.summary: Arjuna reminds Yudhishthira of Bhima's strength and how he killed Jarasandha, releasing kings who then paid tribute to Yudhishthira.

segments.key_quote: Out of curiosity, she joined the two parts and the child became complete and regained life.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's purport explains the unusual birth story of Jarasandha, involving a king, two queens, a mango, a she-demon named Jara, and the joining of two body parts.

segments.key_quote: Shiva is the lord of all ghostly and demoniac men.
segments.summary: The lecture explains that Jarasandha was born with demoniac qualities, making him a devotee of Lord Shiva, who is easily pleased and often worshipped by demons.

segments.key_quote: Jarasandha became very angry against Krishna.
segments.summary: The lecture details how Jarasandha became an enemy of Krishna after Krishna killed Kamsa, who was Jarasandha's son-in-law, leading to Jarasandha's daughters becoming widows.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the real cause for all these happenings.
segments.summary: The lecture describes how Krishna orchestrated Jarasandha's death through Bhima, leading to the release of imprisoned kings who then paid tribute to Yudhishthira, highlighting Krishna's role as the prime mover.
